title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Itwas thus with Dryden : His family were preparingto bury him with the decency becoming theirlimited circumstances, when Charles Montague,Lord Jefferies, and other men of quality, made asubscription for a public funeral. The body of thepoet was then removed to the Physicians' Hall,where it was embalmed, and lay iu state till the13th dav of May, twelve days after the decease. On that day, the celebrated Dr. Garth pronounceda Latin oration over the remains of his departedfriend; which were then, with considerable state,preceded by a band of music, and attended by anumerous procession of carriages, transported toWestminster Abbey, and deposited between thegraves of Chaucer and Cow ley.
